title: Emmerdale spoilers: Can Cain accept Nate as his son after explosion?
text:
Cain Dingle (Jeff Hordley) is a man with a lot on his mind in Emmerdale. Let’s just process how things have gone for him since he woke up that fateful morning. After finishing off his corn flakes and minding his own business, he was told his wife Moira (Natalie J Robb) was cheating on him.

After a quick blast of taking Pete Barton (Anthony Quinlan) hostage and torturing the truth out of him, he headed for a fishing trip with Nate Robinson (Jurell Carter), who admitted to the shenanigans.

He lost his marriage, clubbed Nate over the head, discovered Nate was his son, saved his drowning wife and then saw his boat blown up. Just another average day for Cain – but can he accept that Nate is his son? There are still so many questions to answer.

Nate clearly came to the village to settle a score with his dad and he deliberately seduced Moira with the sole intention of hurting him. Obviously feeling like he has been abandoned by Cain, it remains to be seen exactly who Nate is and who Cain slept with years ago.

Faith (Sally Dexter) seems to have worked it out after finding a photograph in Nate’s caravan and taking a stiff drink before telling Pete that it’s best to leave them to fight it out themselves.

After Cain braved the depths of the lake to save Moira, he dismissed missing Nate as dead but Moira wasn’t prepared to just leave him amid the flaming debris. Nate survived and was pulled to the shore but Cain wasn’t ready to deal with any of this.

He sped off with Moira shouting after him – and he was clearly on a mission. But will Faith give him the answers that he needs?

And does he have further shocks in store?
